description: Japans Kaiser darf abdanken. Das Kabinett billigte ein entsprechendes Gesetz und folgt damit dem Wunsch Akihitos. Es wäre das erste Mal seit rund 200 Jahren, dass ein Monarch in Japan zurücktritt.
title: Japan: Regierung ebnet Weg für Akihitos Abdankung

author: BBC News
description: Princess Mako, eldest granddaughter of the Emperor Akihito, is giving up her royal status for love.
title: Japan's Princess Mako to lose royal status for love

author: BBC News
description: Princess Mako - Emperor Akihito's granddaughter - will lose her royal status by marrying a commoner.
title: Princess Mako to lose Japan royal status by marrying commoner

author: BBC News
description: Princess Mako - Emperor Akihito's granddaughter - will lose her royal status by marrying a commoner.
title: Princess Mako to lose Japan royal status by marrying commoner

author: Motoko Rich
description: Princess Mako, Emperor Akihito’s grandchild, is getting married, and, by law, leaving the royal family. Her departure is highlighting a looming succession crisis.
title: Japanese Princess’s Engagement Revives Debate on Women in Royal Family

description: Japanese Princess Mako, the eldest granddaughter of Emperor Akihito, will lose her royal status by marrying a commoner who she met while studying at university.
title: Japan's Princess Mako giving up royal status for love

author: Elaine Lies
description: Japan's cabinet approved a bill on Friday that would allow Emperor Akihito to step down, paving the way for the first abdication by a Japanese emperor in nearly two centuries.
title: Japan cabinet approves bill to allow emperor to abdicate

author: Dave Quinn
description: Japan's Princess Mako, the eldest daughter of Prince Akishino and granddaughter of Emperor Akihito, will give up her royal status to marry Kei Komuro — a graduate student who works at a law firm.
title: Japan’s Princess Mako Giving up Her Royal Status to Marry Commoner She Met at School

author: Jon Sharman
description: Japanese Princess Mako, the eldest granddaughter of Emperor Akihito, will give up her royal status to marry a former classmate who once worked as a "Prince of the Sea" to promote tourism. Japanese media reported the union would stoke debate on the ever-shrinking royal family since the princess must become a commoner after she marries.
title: Japanese princess 'gives up royal status to marry commoner'
